title: 820-3476 no image
message:
With screen connected 

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is 0v

U7700 pin 12 is 0v, pin 10 is 12.56v, pin 17 is 3.34v

title: 820-3476 no image
message:
Do you get image, only missing backlight???
Check for USB activity at least.

title: 820-3476 no image
message: Yeah need to know is this no image, no backlight or no post. USB activity present? External video present? Tried known good screen? Any history liquid drop etc?

title: 820-3476 no image
message:
Sorry, I was testing this with a bad LCD, with good LCD I get folder no backlight.

Sorry for the tonto question, but is there a screen I can use to test all this boards that use the same connector, say a retina 13" on a retina 15" diferent model year? How about an Air screen on a retina board? I know this is silly to ask but I don't have many parts to test and I am curious about this.

title: 820-3476 no image
message:
First check on schematic if LCD connectors have the same layout.
Second, and most important, Apple changed LCD firmware like hell; almost every year.
You can find on Internet some screen compatibility; on the forum should find something too.

Now no backlight troubleshooting

title: 820-3476 no image
message:
"PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is 0v"
Still the same at LCD connector?

title: 820-3476 no image
message: You can use 13 vs 15 Retina screens interchangeably for testing; HOWEVER, the 2015 is a different screen than the others. Late 2012/Early 2013, Late 2013/Mid 2014, and 2015 all different screens. MacBook Air screen will definitely not work.

title: 820-3476 no image
message:
Post voltage and diode mode at SCL/SDA lines of U7700.
We still pending about history fault.
Also post diode mode to ground at both pins of D7710.

title: 820-3476 no image
message: L7720 was done, replaced it and realized [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT was shorted to ground and the LCD connector was damaged, begginer mistake, that should have been the first thing I had to check, replaced that and the LCD cable as well and al is done and fix, thanks a lot gentleman.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
